alert.note: Alert for Giles (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:38AM EST until January 10 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Giles County in southwest Virginia and portions of Mercer, Monroe, and Summers counties in southeast West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 AM EST, gauge reports indicated that the Bluestone River near Spanishburg, West Virginia and Walker Creek near Bane, Virginia were rising towards flood stage. Several roads are closed in Giles County due to flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pearisburg, Narrows, Pembroke, Athens, Peterstown, Pipestem and Poplar Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
